1.text: Good the poor one going in his integrity above the perverse of lips, and he foolish.

2.text: Also the soul without knowledge is not good, and he hastening with his feat, sins.

3.text: The folly of man will subvert his way: and his heart will be angry against Jehovah.

4.text: Wealth will add many friends; and the poor one will be separated from his neighbor.

5.text: A witness of falsehoods shall not be unpunished, and he breathing out lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many will wait for the face of the prince, and every one the friend to the man giving.

7.text: All the brethren of the poor hated him: how much more his friends removed far from him? pursuing words they are not.

8.text: He obtaining a heart loved his soul: he watched understanding to find good.

9.text: A witness of falsehoods shall not be unpunished, and he breathing out lies shall perish.

10.text: Delight is not becoming to the foolish one; much less for a servant to rule over chiefs.

11.text: The understanding of man will defer his anger: and his glory to pass over transgression.

12.text: The king’s wrath growling as the young lion, and his acceptance as dew upon the grass.

13.text: A foolish son a calamity to his father: and the strifes of a woman a dropping thrust out.

14.text: A house and wealth the inheritance of fathers: and an understanding wife from Jehovah.

15.text: Sloth will cast a deep sleep; and the soul of sloth shall hunger.

16.text: He watching the command watches his soul: he despising his ways shall die.

17.text: He pitying the poor lends to Jehovah, and he will recompense to him his act.

18.text: Correct thy son when there is hope, and thy soul shall not lift up for his sighing.

19.text: The stern in wrath lifted up a fine: for if thou shalt deliver and thou shalt yet add.

20.text: Hear counsel and receive instruction, so that thou shalt be wise in thy latter state.

21.text: Many purposes in a man’s heart: and the counsel of Jehovah, that shall stand.

22.text: The desire of man his mercy: and the poor good above the man of falsehood.

23.text: The fear of Jehovah is to life: and he being filled shall lodge satisfied; he shall not be reviewed for evil.

24.text: The slothful one hiding his hand in the dish, also he will not turn it back to his mouth.

25.text: Thou shalt strike him mocking, and the simple will be crafty: and reprove to him understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

26.text: He oppressing the father and putting the mother to flight, is a son causing shame and causing disgrace.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear instructions for erring from the words of knowledge.

28.text: A witness of Belial shall mock judgment: and the mouth of the unjust will swallow down iniquity.

29.text: Judgment was prepared for those mocking, and blows for the back of the foolish.
